Final: 10/10 ( Como dije, el clasico de los clasicos )

Limba romana:
Avand in vedere ca jocul a fost creeat in 1999 Counter Strike 1.6 peste 20 de ani de la lansare inca o duce bine in prezent cel putin in Romania cu serverele la toate modurile cel mai popular in prezent e Mod-ul CSGO aproape e lafel ca jocul original Counter-Strike: Global Offesive cu hartile sale din 1.6 si cele din CSGO poti deschide cutii sa primesti skinu-uri si sa faci afaceri cu skinurile cu ceilalti playeri de pe server modurile mele preferate din Counter-Strike este: CSGO si zombie plague orele pe care le am facut in joc pe steam sunt 161 de ore si no steam peste 10.000 de ore jocul asta ma joc de la varsta de 7 ani din cauza ca se juca si frati-miu mai mare e peste 5 ani mai in varsta decat mine ma uitam mereu cum se juca si intr-o zii mi a zis sa incerc si eu eu am vrut modul classic ca pe vremea de atunci imi era frica sa joc la zombie mode si am inceput sa ma joc classic nu eram bun la inceput dar cu timpul am inceput sa joc bine la inceput stateam intr-un colt si asteptam inamici sa vina si cand eram la echipa tero unde trebuia sa plantez bomba :) dar cu timpul a inceput sa joc destul de bine si c am pe la 8 ani si jumate m am vindecat de teama  sa joc la mod zombie prima oara am jucat pe un server nu ii mai stiu numele dar era mod plague nu am prins vremea internet caffe-uri sala de calculatoare sunt din generatia 2004 am auzit de la prieteni mai mari decat mine ca era misto si nu toti aveau calculatoare cum e in prezent.
Language English:
Given that the game was created in 1999 Counter Strike 1.6 over 20 years since its launch, it is still doing well today at least in Romania with servers in all modes. original Counter-Strike: Global Offesive with its 1.6 and CSGO maps you can open boxes to receive skins and do business with the skins with the other players on the server. My favorite Counter-Strike modes are: CSGO and zombie plague hours I played in the game on steam are 161 hours and no steam over 10,000 hours this game I play since I was 7 years old because it is played and my older brother is over 5 years older than me I was always watching how it was played and one day he told me to try and I wanted the classic mode because at that time I was afraid to play zombie mode and I started playing classic I wasn't good at first but with time I started to play well at first I was sitting in a corner and waiting enemies to come and when I was on the tero team where I had to plant the bomb :) but over time it started to play pretty well and when I was about 8 and a half I healed for fear of playing zombie mode the first time I played on a server I don't know his name anymore but it was a plague way I didn't catch the weather internet cafes computer room are from the 2004 generation I heard from friends older than me that it was cool and not everyone had computers like it is now.

It's the best retro FPS game !

There's a remaster-ish Counter-Strike you get together with this (or rather you get this together with that), but for the record: I prefer this one, the original.

Counter-Strike used to be my curse and my primary hobby. I have thousands upon thousands of hours spent in this game. So many nights... I had a dozen of Steam accounts created only to play CS on a (now dead) platform called PlayZeek, which was kind of what FaceIT is for CS:GO. This game represents my childhood and when I say CS all I think about is nostalgia.

CS's middlename is ESports, and it would not be an understatement if we would say that ESports wouldn't be today what it is, without this game. This game's ESports has died, obviously, but the game's community did not. Which is mindblowing. You don't have an issue finding a server with players at any given time, night or day. For a game so old it's wow. So if you're nostalgic and want to get back into this game, you won't have one problem, even after all this time. 

But for someone that has never played this before.. it is hard, it takes thousands of hours to learn the recoil and gameplay, has not aged well, looks ugly and the gameplay can probably only be understood and enjoyed by people that have understood and enjoyed it at its time. 

Going back to the game for a little bit of time was something unique. The feels, the nostalgia, the sounds, the gameplay, everything sends me back to my childhood, to a time without adult issues and only free time to waste (or spend) playing CS and dreaming of becoming the best. And expected to start the game, join a server, die instantly and then leave. But it actually made me play more. And I actually started to enjoy it. But I also understood the reasons why I would never come back to the game. What I have once seen as masterpiece, I now see as old gameplay. I still find it fun, to a point, I just can't see it with the same eyes I once did. 

This is a relic, a masterpiece for its time. To a point it can still be for most people that have used to play it at that time. I think updating the graphics to today standards, and maybe meddling a little bit with the gameplay, would make this game appeal to new people. The fact that this game has never died after sooooo many years, and it still has such an alive playerbase, says a lot. Normally I would suggest you play CS:GO instead of this, but I see them as totally different games, for probably different players. This one requires way more skill and it is way more punishing. What this game needs is the same gameplay and feel, but with today visuals. CS:CO (Classic Offensive) is more fitting to suggest here, but unfortunately, at the time writing this, it is still in development.
